revised_title: Investigation of Luminescence in Solid Nitrogen Doped with Oxygen
tldr: The authors studied the luminescence of solid nitrogen doped with 0.1% oxygen using low-energy electron excitation. They examined the atom emissions and associated vibrational sidebands using a variable temperature liquid helium cryostat and photoelectric recording. The results showed that the electronic transition is split into three zero-phonon lines, and the vibrational sidebands appear with an intensity distribution resembling phonon-induced electronic transitions.
